Posts.Content: Haven't posted for a while but I've done it. Had my 6th and final EC. Now resting at home and trying to avoid the colds and sickness bug everyone seems to have. If I manage to escape them my experience wasn't nearly as bad as I feared. I've had all 6 via cannula in one hand with no problem. My veins are fine and look normal though my arm is a little tight if I straighten it. This usually eases after a few days. The first cycle was a learning curve but by 2 and 3 I had the nausea, heartburn and constipation under control with help from my CNS. My hospital give everyone Corsodyl mouthwash from the off so I haven't had a sore mouth or ulcers. The fatigue really built up as I expected and I barely recovered from cycle 5 before it was time for 6. But I now have 4 weeks  before I see the oncologist and sort out my radiotherapy. But chemo is over. There were tears.

Posts.Content: And well done to you too Badgerset. Hope the rest of your recovery goes smoothly. Even though we haven't encountered any major problems with chemo it's still a tough old thing to go through. Should also say the longer chemo went on the more I've embraced my baldness. I have lots of hats, scarves and a wig but I'm now comfortable sitting in my local or a restaurant without them. I've got to kind of like it ! Also my weight is pretty much as it was before chemo. I haven't been as active but my appetite isn't what it was. My meals have been healthy but smaller and I haven't felt the urge to snack.

Posts.Content: Hi Claire  I had  a WLE and SLNB in September which went very well but the Oncotype DX came back with a high score which was a huge shock as chemo had never been mentioned until then. I had my first of 6 cycles of EC on 31st October so we are on this journey together. First night I was nauseous and had heartburn but it cleared the next day. By far the worst thing so far has been the constipation. I'd done the right things - lots of water, diet. - but day 6 was awful. Cramps like labour pains and vomiting.  When I see the Oncologist before my next cycle I'm going to request preventative laxative !
Posts.Title: First EC down but proper fed up

Posts.Content: I think the vomiting was probably down to the fact I'd just eaten before the cramps started. I'm feeling ok now. Bit tired and my legs are heavy and a little achy today but I've had the last of the injections this morning. I had a headache the day after chemo but managed to sort it with paracetamol fortunately. My tumour was small and the WLE had clear margins and the nodes were clear. The consultant had discussed radiotherapy when I was diagnosed but it was only later that he told me about the Oncotype DX test and chemo was first mentioned when I got the result. Must be very hard for you with a young family. Mine are grown up now and there's just me and OH at home. We are muddling through together. Be nice if you and I get a bit of 'normal' time now before round 2 !
